Key Match Events: LaMelo Ball scored a team-high 32 points as the Charlotte Hornets defeated the Phoenix Suns, 115-104.
Brandon Miller made a 32-foot desperation heave at the shot clock buzzer for the Hornets' first points.
The Hornets held the Suns to 25% shooting from the field and 0% from three in the second quarter.
LaMelo Ball made a pair of ridiculous threes in the third quarter.
Nick Smith Jr. assisted Miles Bridges with a half court alley oop in the fourth quarter.
Brandon Miller hit a dagger three to secure the win for the Hornets.
Post-Match Reflections: LaMelo Ball is making a compelling argument to start the All-Star Game.
Miles Bridges redeemed himself after struggling against the Cleveland Cavaliers.
Nick Richards provided a spark off the bench with 15 points, 12 rebounds, five offensive boards, and three blocks.
